item.title: Report E-2024100607
item.description:
Report E-2024100607

Identified by scraper @ 2024-10-25T09:22:20+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-10-23
  • City: MENOMONEE FALLS
  • State: WI
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: VEOLIA ES TECHNICAL SOLUTIONS, L.L.C.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: On October 23, 2024, an incident occurred at Veolia's ten-day in-transit facility located in Menomonee Falls, Wisconsin. During a routine unloading operation, a Veolia employee was using a forklift to remove a pallet from a trailer when the forklift's forks accidentally punctured a drum positioned behind the pallet being unloaded. As a result of this incident, less than one gallon of waste flammable liquid was released from the punctured drum. Immediate action was taken to address the situation by promptly overpacking the damaged drum to prevent further leakage. Hazmat-trained Veolia employees conducted a thorough remediation of the spilled material. The swift response and proper handling of the situation by trained personnel ensured that the environmental impact was minimized and safety protocols were followed.

item.title: Report E-2024100589
item.description:
Report E-2024100589

Identified by scraper @ 2024-10-25T09:22:20+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-10-22
  • City: OKLAHOMA CITY
  • State: OK
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: XPO LOGISTICS, LLC
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 6500
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: XPO Logistics terminal LOO experienced a UN3018 Pilot 4E Pesticide release from a 265-gallon poly tote. ERTS dispatched contractors to complete cleanup operations. Contractors arrived onsite and confirmed approximately 4 cups of product released to a 4’ x 2’ area of the trailer floor due to a pinhole puncture. The material was transferred from the damaged tote into a new one. Absorbents were worked into the impacted area. The empty damaged tote was then cut up and containerized along with all impacted absorbents into (2) 30-gallon poly drums. The waste was staged onsite for terminal personnel to manage.

Report E-2024100590

Identified by scraper @ 2024-10-25T09:22:20+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-10-22
  • City: SANTA FE SPRINGS
  • State: CA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: XPO LOGISTICS FREIGHT, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 7500
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: XPO-Logistics contacted ERTS regarding a punctured 55-gallon DF containing hazardous product, Starlite Built Liquid Alkali. A contractor dispatched and observed a 55-gallon release (total loss) of product due to a forklift puncture that impacted the trailer floor in a 40’x8.5’ area and the concrete beneath the trailer in a 40’x10’ area. The contractor neutralized the release with citric acid and contained the release with oil dry and booms. Four drums of waste were generated from the response that contained the RCRA-empty drum, the neutralized impacted oil dry, shrink-wrap, and booms. XPO will manage all waste generated from the response. No storm-drains, waterways, or soil were involved in this incident.

item.title: Report E-2024100592
item.description:
Report E-2024100592

Identified by scraper @ 2024-10-25T09:22:20+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-10-21
  • City: GLENPOOL
  • State: OK
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: XPO LOGISTICS, LLC
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 6500
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: XPO Logistics terminal LTU experienced a UN2924 Silquest A-1101 Silane release from a 330-gallon metal tote. ERTS dispatched contractors to conduct onsite cleanup operations. Contractors arrived onsite and confirmed approximately 3 gallons of material released to a 10’ x 10’ area of the trailer floor due to a loose tote cap. The release impacted on the trailer floor, walls, ceiling, dunnage, and a poly tote in the trailer. Vinegar was utilized to clean and neutralize the impacted areas along with pads and oil dri. The cap was re-tightened on the tote and secured for shipment on. All impacted pads, absorbents, and cleanup debris were placed into 55-gallon poly drum. The waste was staged onsite for terminal personnel to manage.

  • Description: On 10/11/2024 at approximately 1730, Dangerous Goods Administration received a call from Employee 966383 and the station location in Ronkonkoma, reporting a dangerous goods spill. The shipment is a large cylinder. The shipment was reported to have fallen from the sort belt and began to make a "hissing" sound, indicating that the cylinder was releasing pressure. After evaluation, the shipment was isolated from people and other freight until completely depressurized. The shipment is being for customer pick-up.

item.description:
Report E-2024100599

Identified by scraper @ 2024-10-25T09:22:20+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-10-09
  • City: DAYTON
  • State: OH
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: VEOLIA ES TECHNICAL SOLUTIONS, L.L.C.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: On 10/9/24, a drum from SD Myers was delivered to Veolia's ten-day in-transit facility and temporarily placed on the dock pending transfer to another trailer for final disposal. During the subsequent loading process for outbound transportation, facility personnel observed liquid on the floor near the drum's location. Upon investigation, it was discovered that a pinhole in the bottom chime of the drum had allowed its contents to leak. To address this issue, the following actions were taken: 1. The compromised drum was immediately overpacked to ensure safe continued transportation. 2. The affected concrete surface was thoroughly decontaminated in full compliance with the procedures outlined in 40 CFR § 761.79(b)(4). These prompt actions ensured the containment of the spill, the safe handling of the drum, and the proper remediation of the affected area, all in accordance with applicable regulations and safety protocols.

item.description:
Report I-2024100124

Identified by scraper @ 2024-10-25T09:22:20+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-09-17
  • City: Nashville
  • State: TN
  • Report Type: Undeclared Shipment with no Release
  • Mode Of Transportation: Air
  • Carrier/Reporter: DELTA AIR LINES
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: At BNA, on 09/17/2024, Air Waybi1189501915 containing twenty-four skids weighing 3,278 pounds was offered to Delta Cargo. Following the unloading of the truck, the agent observed UN3480 labels on a box located on one of the skids. Upon additional examination, the team took out a box to find CARGO AIRCRAFT ONLY labels aligned inwardly against one another, with UN3480 tags concealed by white stickers. There were seven pallets, each containing approximately 30 boxes. The entire shipment was rejected during acceptance. This FAA was notified. The event remains under investigation.

  • City: RENO
  • State: NV
  • Report Type: Undeclared Shipment with no Release

  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: On 10/11/2024 at approximately 2015, Dangerous Goods Administration received a call from Employee 5570334 at the station location in Reno, reporting undeclared dangeorus goods. The shipment consisted of one fiberboard box, containing 8 lithium ion batteries. The shipment was suspected of improper preparation after being previously refused at the counter. The shipper later applied the lithium battery mark and tendered the shipment again. Further investigation revealed that the each of the inner packages were labeled UN 3480, indicating that the shipment should have been tendered as fully regulated dangerous goods. The shipment is being held, pending an FAA investigation.

  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: Pax Devtosh Dubry came to the aft galley and told us his Iphone 14 was overheating. I felt the phone and it was very hot. He gave us the phone,(phone was turned off),we looked in the efoam. we followed instructions for the thermal containment bag. Placed the ped in the bag, sealed it and locked in the aft Iavatory. The captain and purser were informed. After passengers deplaned, the tcb was handed to the csr.

  • Description: On 10/02/2024 drums were picked up from Univar Solutions Norcross facility and delivered to Univar Solutions in Chattanooga. When arriving in Chattanooga the supervisor at the plant noticed a small amount of product coming out of the trailer towards the nose. When opening the door there was one drum of 40 discovered to be leaking. Hepaco was called on site and maintained/handled the cleanup. It was discovered that a drum was punctured by a nail on a pallet losing approximately 3301bs of sodium bisulfite. It looked like the drum may have shifted slightly and hit the nail. When leaving Norcross there were not any issues or signs of damage to the drum.

  • Description: . Customer heard a loud pop from his backpack that was stored underneath his seat . Customer discovered that his vape pen had exploded and was smoldering in the backpack . Fully boarded aircraft was deplaned as smoke was coming from the backpack . Law Enforcement, TSA, and the Fire Department arrived to assess the event. Fire department personnel and authorities inspected the passenger's bag, confiscated the vape pen, and cleared the passenger of any security concerns. The item was placed in a Port Authority ARFF TCB for removal from the aircraft . There has been some social media activity related to this event . No aircraft damage or passenger injuries reported

  • Total Amount Of Damages: 8000
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: On September 30, 2024, at 1015 ET, XPO Logistics Terminal UFN experienced release of UN1760 “Tower NG 7100” from a 275-gallon poly tote. The release impacted the trailer floor and concrete lot below due to a puncture caused by improper loading. ERTS dispatched contractors to conduct all on site cleanup activities. On September 30, 2024, at 1700 EST, contractors arrived on site and confirmed approximately 7-gallons of product released to a 23' x 4' area of the trailer floor and a 1’ x 1’ area of the concrete lot below due to a puncture caused by improper loading. The material was transferred from the damaged tote into a new one. The impacted area was then cleaned with Spilfyter KolorSafe Base Neutralizer and Floor Dry. The damaged tote, impacted absorbents, pads, and PPE were then collected into (7) 55-gallon poly drums. The waste was staged onsite for terminal personnel to manage.

  • City: Dore
  • State: ND
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Rail

  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0

  • Total Amount Of Damages: 3000
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: 9/28/24 BNSF train crews noticed vapor emanating from the top of the RCRX 2821 while moving the car in Dore, ND. The crew isolated the car and notifications were made. BNSF contractor Pinnacle Engineering responded to inspect the car and found liquid hydrochloric acid on the liquid line flange as confirmed by pH strips. The liquid line flange bolts were found to be less than finger tight and easily moved by hand. Responders tightened and secured the flange and neutralized the acid. Other bolts on the valves and pressure plate were inspected and tightened further using crescent wrenches. The car was held pending receipt of an approved OTMA for further movement.

item.title: Report E-2024090548
item.description:
Report E-2024090548

Identified by scraper @ 2024-10-24T09:29:40+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-09-18
  • City: MORGANTOWN
  • State: WV
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: COWAN TRANSPORT SERVICES, LLC
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 50000
  • Serious Incident Ind: Yes
  • Description: On September 18, 2024, Cowan Intermodal Group, LLC contacted Emergency Response and Training Solutions (ERTS) of a release in Morgantown, WV. It was reported an undetermined amount of Belclene® 200 was due to a single vehicle accident was caused by the truck striking a guardrail and flipping onto its side, the release impacted soil, asphalt and a nearby storm drain. It was also reported the impacted area was 60ft by 30ft and approximately 5000 gallons of product. Contractors were dispatched to the site to perform all onsite clean-up activities. Upon arrival, contractors contacted DOT to provide traffic control to excavate the damaged travel lines. Excavation was complete asphalt milling and a surface scrape that measured 85ft by 8ft area. 2 roll offs containing impacted soil and 3 roll off boxes of asphalt milling were collected. There were 16 totes total involved. The product was vacuumed out of the bottom of the trailer into 1 vac truck and 9 different totes for transfer. The 16 damaged totes were placed in 2 roll off boxes and staged at a near by DOT site. All waste generated was taken off-site for proper disposal.

item.title: Report X-2024100827
item.description:
Report X-2024100827

Identified by scraper @ 2024-10-24T09:29:40+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-09-18
  • City: MEMPHIS
  • State: TN
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Rail
  • Carrier/Reporter: ILLINOIS CENTRAL RAILROAD COMPANY
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 20000
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: On 09/18/2024, while working in MP31 track, Presidents Island Yard, Memphis, TN, FRA Inspector Mr. Ken Barefield observed a dark liquid leaking from the top of PROX70548, (Load, Environmentally Hazardous Substance, Liquid N.O.S., (Benzo (b) Fluoranthene, Benzo (A) Pyrene, Contain S), UN3082) down the side of the tank car to the ground. FRA Inspector Barefield notified CN Dangerous Goods Officer (DGO) Vaughan. FRA Inspector Barefield advised that 6 of the 8 nuts on the manway cover bolts were ?less than tool tight?. CN Dangerous Goods Officer (DGO) Vaughan performed an inspection of the tank car and found the 6 of 8 nuts on the manway cover bolts to be ?less than tool tight?. Upon further inspection, the manway cover was opened, and the manway cover gasket was observed to be broken. The shipper applied cable seal # 471609 was observed in place and intact at the time of the release. The responding CN Dangerous Goods Officer (DGO) removed the existing manway cover gasket segments, then cleaned the sealing surfaces of the manway cover and the rim nozzle and were inspected for metal burs. Product residue on the manway cover and rim nozzle was removed using a cleaner and absorbents. A new rim nozzle gasket made of ?Viton A?, was properly installed and secured using a 18" pipe wrench to tighten the manway cover bolts ?tool tight?. Product spillage on the sides of the tank car, loader platform handrails and walking boards along with other safety appliances were cleaned using a cleaning solution recommended by the consignee and absorbents. Tank car was secured and released to CN Transportation for delivery to consignee. New Seals # CNDG 200031-Manway, CNDG 000980-Protective Housing, CNDG 200033-Bottom Outlet Valve Cap, CNDG 000984-Bottom Outlet Valve Handle and Securing Pin, were applied.

  • Description: XPO-Logistics contacted ERTS regarding a leaking bung cap on a 55-gallon DF containing hazardous laundry detergent. A contractor dispatched and observed an estimated 2-gallons of laundry detergent released onto the wooden trailer floor in a 3’x4’ area due to a leaking bung cap on the poly drum. Oil dry was applied to the release and the remaining product in the damaged drum was transferred into a new 55-gallon DF. Impacted oil dry and PPE was placed into an 05-gallon DF for waste disposal. XPO will manage the recovered product and the waste generated from the response. No storm-drains, waterways, or soil were involved in this incident.

item.title: Report X-2024101372
item.description:
Report X-2024101372

Identified by scraper @ 2024-10-23T09:14:59+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-10-14
  • City: MIDDLETOWN
  • State: PA
  • Report Type: Undeclared Shipment with no Release
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: FEDERAL EXPRESS CORPORATION
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: On 10/14/2024 at approximately 1530, Dangerous Goods Administration received a call from Employee 475356 at the ramp faclity in Middletown, reporting undeclared dangerous goods. This is a multiple piece shipment that consists of 6 fiberboard boxes, each containing one 44 lb. bag of pigment . One of the labels on the outer packages identifies the inner contents as "DCL Quindo Magenta" and displays a GHS corrosive mark. Dangerous Goods Administration acquired an online safety data sheet, which classified the commodity as UN 1263 Paint. Further inspection of the packages confirmed this classification. None of the packages displayed the required markings, labeling, packaging and paperwork that were in accordance with IATA Regulations. The shipment is being held for an FAA investigation. UPDATE: After attaining a safety data sheet from the shipper, it had been confirmed that this commodity classified as a nonhazardous shipment.

item.description:
Report X-2024101375

Identified by scraper @ 2024-10-23T09:14:59+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-10-05
  • City: SPOKANE
  • State: WA
  • Report Type: Undeclared Shipment with no Release
  • Mode Of Transportation: Air
  • Carrier/Reporter: Federal Express Corporation
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: On 10/5/2024 at approxiamtely 1230, Dangerous Goods Administration received a call from Employee 260014 at the station location in Spokane, reporting undeclared dangerous goods. The shipment consists for one aerosol can packaged in a padded envelope. The shipment was discovered after having the distinct rattling sound. The shipment was not prepared in accordance in IATA Regulations, missing the required markings, labeling, packaging and paperwork. The shipment is being held, pending an FAA investigation.

item.title: Report E-2024100526
item.description:
Report E-2024100526

Identified by scraper @ 2024-10-23T09:14:59+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-10-02
  • City: SPRINGFIELD
  • State: IL
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: R & L CARRIERS, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 5000
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: On October 2, 2024, one (1) 55-gallon drum of methanol was punctured and released approximately one (1) gallon of product to the dock floor. R+L Carriers retained Cura Emergency Services. LC who dispatched a crew from Environmental Works, Inc. (EWI) to remediate the impacted site. The crew was unable to identify any released product and concluded that any released methanol had evaporated prior to arrival. EWI Personnel utilized chemical tape to patch the hole in the drum. The damaged 55-gallon drum was placed into one (1) 85-gallon overpack and was staged onsite for future disposal.

item.title: Report E-2024100501
item.description:
Report E-2024100501

Identified by scraper @ 2024-10-22T09:15:04+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-10-17
  • City: HIALEAH
  • State: FL
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: XPO LOGISTICS, LLC
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 4500
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: XPO Logistics terminal NMF experienced a UN2735 Sika Flow 648 release from a box containing (4) 1-gallon poly jugs. ERTS dispatched contractors to conduct onsite cleanup operations. Contractors arrived onsite and confirmed approximately 1-gallon of product released to a 4’ x 4’ area of the pallet and packaging located on the dock due to a forklift puncture. The impacted area was cleaned with absorbents and sodium bicarb to clean and neutralize the impacted pallet. The damaged jug, impacted jugs, impacted absorbents, neutralizer, cardboard, pads, and PPE were collected and containerized into a 55-gallon poly drum. The waste was staged onsite for terminal personnel to manage.

Identified by scraper @ 2024-10-22T09:15:04+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-10-16
  • City: MIAMI
  • State: FL
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: FEDERAL EXPRESS CORPORATION
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: On 10/16/2024 at approximately 1345, Dangerous Goods Administration received a call from Employee 5190395 at the ramp facility in Miami, reporting undeclared dangerous goods. The shipment is an acuator for jet turbine engine. The shipment began emiiting an odor and ganered the attention of the dangeorus goods agent. Further investigation confimed the inner contents as a turbine acuator. The shipment was not prepared in accordance with the IATA Regulations, missing the required markings labeling, packaging, and paperwork. The shipment is being held for an FAA investigation.

item.title: Report X-2024101206
item.description:
Report X-2024101206

Identified by scraper @ 2024-10-22T09:15:04+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-10-15
  • City: SAVANNAH
  • State: GA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: FEDERAL EXPRESS CORPORATION
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: THe shipment was discovered leaking in the drivers van during offload. The package was picked up by FedEx and found leaking when the vehicle arrived at the station. Absorbent pads and vermiculite were used to contain and clean up the spill. No other packages were affected. The package contained 4 metal cans in a fiberboard box surrounded in bubble wrap, and overpacked. 3 metal cans were leaking from the top. The remaining contents were placed in a salvage drum and held pending disposition from the shipper.

item.title: Report X-2024101218
item.description:
Report X-2024101218

Identified by scraper @ 2024-10-22T09:15:04+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-10-14
  • City: MIDDLETOWN
  • State: PA
  • Report Type: Undeclared Shipment with no Release
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: FEDERAL EXPRESS CORPORATION
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: On 10/14/2024 at approximately 1530, Dangerous Goods Administration received a call from Employee 475356 at the ramp faclity in Middletown, reporting undeclared dangerous goods. This is a multiple piece shipment that consists of 6 fiberboard boxes, each containing one 44 lb. bag of pigment . One of the labels on the outer packages identifies the inner contents as "DCL Quindo Magenta" and displays a GHS corrosive mark. Dangerous Goods Administration acquired an online safety data sheet, which classified the commodity as UN 1263 Paint. Further inspection of the packages confirmed this classification. None of the packages displayed the required markings, labeling, packaging and paperwork that were in accordance with IATA Regulations. The shipment is being held for an FAA investigation.

  • Description: Package was discovered in a trailer with a large stain on one side. Upon inspection, it was found that the package contained four bottles of detergent, one of which had an unsecured cap. The loose cap allowed the contents of the bottle to leak through the exterior package, creating the stain and contaminating the adjacent package. No visible damage was noticed besides the stain/leak.

item.title: Report E-2024100514
item.description:
Report E-2024100514

Identified by scraper @ 2024-10-22T09:15:04+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-10-08
  • City: ARLINGTON
  • State: TX
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: VEOLIA ES TECHNICAL SOLUTIONS, L.L.C.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: Veolia employees were performing quality control checks in the warehouse at Veolia's ten day intransit facility when they noticed a 4G lab pack box was leaking a bright blue-green material. They immediately notified their supervisor, and the material was identified as "UN2586 Aryl Sulfonic Acids, Liquid with Not More than 5% Free Sulfuric Acid (4-Dodecylbenzenesulfonic Acid), 8, III." Approximately <= 10 mL of free liquids had leaked onto the warehouse floor. The team immediately overpacked the material and used vermiculite absorbent to clean up residual liquids from the floor. After reviewing the incident, two conditions leading to the spill were discovered: 1.) A small cut in the inner liner near the top of the bag was discovered. Veolia believes this was caused during the initial packaging process or after someone reopened the box with a safety blade. This allowed for vermiculite absorbent and free liquids to escape the liner and leak into the box interior. 2.) The bottom of the box was not sealed properly; the middle seam was taped as required, but the side seams were left untaped, which allowed an easier pathway for the interior fluid to escape.

item.description:
Report X-2024101125

Identified by scraper @ 2024-10-22T09:15:04+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-10-03
  • City: KLAMATH FALLS
  • State: OR
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Rail
  • Carrier/Reporter: BNSF RAILWAY COMPANY
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 4000
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: ODOT Hazmat Inspector C. Kuenzi found the CBTX 725571 with wetness on top of the BOV cap threads. The car was isolated and BNSF contracted Graymar Env to respond and inspect the car. The cap was found in a tool tight condition and valve was fully closed. The cap was removed and styrene was found inside the cap and on the threads. The responders cleaned and inspected the gasket and applied teflon tape on the nozzle threads and reinstalled the cap. There was no release to the ground, all styrene residue remained on the car. The shipper was notified to apply for an OTMA to allow the car to continue in transportation to be offloaded and inspected further for possible repairs to the BOV and cap.

  • Serious Incident Ind: Yes
  • Description: The KAG Specialty Products Group, LLC driver was in the process of delivering Aromatic Petroleum Distillates into the customer's storage tank. The driver inadvertently disconnected a delivery hose that was still under pressure. This allowed approximately 60 gallons of product to be released. Customer personnel handled the remediation. A small amount of product was able to spray onto the driver and resulted in them seeking medical treatment.

item.title: Report E-2024100492
item.description:
Report E-2024100492

Identified by scraper @ 2024-10-21T12:23:20+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-10-17
  • City: LAREDO
  • State: TX
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: LANDSTAR INWAY, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 10000
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: On October 17, 2024, at 1621 ET, Emergency Response and Training Solutions (ERTS) was contacted by Landstar personnel in Laredo, TX regarding the release of LACQUER FOR EXT. CAPS. Contractors were dispatched to the site to perform all onsite clean-up activities. Upon arrival, contractors confirmed the release of 10 gallons of LACQUER FOR EXT. CAPS. (UN1263, 3, III) from (1) 55-gallon metal drum onto the trailer floor and asphalt. The release was reportedly due to a puncture of the drum, impacting a 20’ x 10’ area in the trailer and a 20’ x 7’ area on the asphalt. No drains or waterways were impacted by the release. The release was cleaned up with absorbents and the proper PPE. The damaged drum was secured in an overpack and continued on with the original consignee. All waste generated from addressing this release was containerized in (1) 55-gallon DM, which was then taken offsite by the contractor for proper disposal. (Full ship from address: Carretera Chichimequillas KM 5.5 Parque Industrial Puerta El Marques , QR 76240)

  • Description: XPO Logistics terminal XDM experienced a UN3018 Pilot 4E release from a 330-gallon poly tote. ERTS dispatched contractors to conduct cleanup operations. Contractors arrived onsite and confirmed approximately 4-gallons of product released to a 12’ x 3’ area of the trailer floor due to a crack on the top tote corner. The material was transferred from the damaged tote into a new one. The impacted area was then cleaned with absorbents. The damaged tote was then cut up and containerized along with all impacted absorbents into a 55-gallon poly drum. The waste was staged onsite for terminal personnel to manage.

item.description:
Report E-2024100442

Identified by scraper @ 2024-10-21T12:23:20+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-10-16
  • City: ABILENE
  • State: TX
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: XPO LOGISTICS, LLC
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 7500
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: XPO Logistics terminal LAB experience a battery acid release from a 2400-pound UN2794, Battery, Wet, Filled with Acid. ERTS dispatched contractors to conduct cleanup operations. Contractors arrived onsite and confirmed approximately 10-gallons of product released to a 23’ x 8’ area of the trailer floor and a 30’ x 10’ area of the concrete lot below. The battery was not properly secured and fell over as a result, resulting in acid releasing from the caps and breaking the pallet. The battery was up righted and resecured for shipment on. Absorbents and soda ash were deployed to clean and neutralize the impacted areas. All impacted absorbents, impacted pallet wood, poly, and cleanup debris were then containerized into (2) 55-gallon, a 25-gallon, and a 30-gallon poly drums. The waste was staged onsite for terminal personnel to manage.

Identified by scraper @ 2024-10-21T12:23:20+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-10-15
  • City: MASPETH
  • State: NY
  • Report Type: Undeclared Shipment with no Release
  • Mode Of Transportation: Air
  • Carrier/Reporter: UNITED PARCEL SERVICE
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: AN AIR PACKAGE AT THE DELIVERY DESTINATION CENTER WAS INSPECTED DUE TO SUSPICION OF CONTAINING UNDECLARED CONTENTS. UPON INSPECTION OF THE CONTENTS DISCOVERED TWENTY USED IPHONES. AT LEAST THREE OF THE IPHONES HAD ENOUGH CHARGE TO POWER ON. THE IPHONES WERE PACKAGED IN BUBBLE WRAP. THERE ARE NO DANGEROUS GOODS MARKS OR LABELS ON THE OUTER BOX. PRIOR TO THE UNDECLARED LITHIUM BATTERY DISCOVERY, THE PACKAGE WAS FLOWN ON UPS AIRCRAFT. THE SHIPPER CONTACT NAME ON THERMAL LABEL IS JOHN DAZA (311) 242-5997.

item.description:
Report X-2024100877

Identified by scraper @ 2024-10-21T12:23:20+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-10-10
  • City: ANCHORAGE
  • State: AK
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Air
  • Carrier/Reporter: Federal Express Corporation
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: Pkg Info ( TRK NBR=779146570637 PKG TYPE=Package (box/drum/jerrican/composite) PHY STATE=Liquid TRANSPORTATION PHASE=In Transit ) Commodity Info ( UNDG NBR=3082 CLASS=90 QTY UOM=Liquid - Liter PSN TEXT=Amines, Liquid,Corrosive N.O.S.(a-2-Aminomethylethyl) (2-aminomethyltoxy)pol[oxy(methyl-1,2ethannedil)]) Part B PKG GRP=III SPILLED QTY=0.0 CONTAINER CAPACITY=4 CONTAINER UOM=Liquid - Liter MATERIAL CONSTRUCTION=A - Metal (any type) NUMBER IN SHIPMENT=1 NUMBER FAILED=1 INNER PKG TYPE=2 - Can TOTAL AMT IN EACH CONTAINER=3.75 TOTAL UOM=Liquid - Liter TECH NAME=Polyaspartic Part B )On 10/10/2024 at approximately 1845, Dangerous Goods Adminstration received a call from Employee 261690 at the ramp facility in Anchorage, reporting a dangerous goods. The shipment consisted of one fiberboard box containing two metal cans. One of the cans appeared to have a dislodged lid resulting in spillage. The shipment was placed in a salvage drum and awaits further disposition instructions from the recipient, as it was prepared under Special Provisions A197 of the IATA Regulations.

  • Description: Pkg missing required Hazmat certification, OP-900LL tear-away Hazmat tags and proper markings for a pkg containing flammable liquids/solids. Too much weight caused the corner and bottom of the carton to rip exposing the contents and allowing contents to fall out of the carton. 1 x 16 oz. plastic bottle fell out cracking the bottom corner of the bottle which allowed liquid to leak - no visible damage to contents. Pkg contains an assortment of surgical/medical supplies consisting of Germicidal Wipes with a Flash Point below 74 F, Isopropyl Rubbing Alcohol (Flash Point above 150 F), tape, printer labels, gauze/sponges etc.

item.title: Report X-2024100896
item.description:
Report X-2024100896

Identified by scraper @ 2024-10-21T12:23:20+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-10-08
  • City: PFLUGERVILLE
  • State: TX
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: ABF Freight
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: Mindy Smith Operations Supervisor called safety to report a spill in trailer 85389, UN3264, CORROSIVE LIQUID ACIDICINORGANIC N.O .S., 8, PG II,. Mindy stated the freight looked to have been loaded in the nose of the trailer incorrectly and the bottom of the box was damaged causing one 1 gallon pail to spill on the trailer and other freight. Mindy stated it looked to be around 64oz of the product had spilled from the nose of the trailer on to the concrete on the ground in front of the dock door 11. Mindy stated the pallet was moved from the nose of the trailer to the door to take a better look at the box and the pail that spilled. Mindy stated the spill happened in transit and looks to have had other freight damage the box with the 1 gallon pail. Mindy stated after looking at the pail it looked to have spilled 1 gallon from the 1 gallon pail on the trailer floor, other freight and the gro und (concrete) outside the dock door 11. Mindy asked if the crew could unload the rest of the trailer and wipe off the spill that was on the other freight. Safety advised Mindy to stop work on the trailer and wait for a cleaning crew to assist with the cleaning of the freight, trailer floor and the ground outside the dock door. Mindy stated no water ways or drains are affected by the spill. The box slipped between the pallet boards and the forks of a forklift appear to have slit one of the gallon pail of product in the box.

item.title: Report E-2024100478
item.description:
Report E-2024100478

Identified by scraper @ 2024-10-21T12:23:20+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-10-04
  • City: ALEXANDRIA
  • State: IN
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: R&L CARRIERS SHARED SERVICES, L.L.C.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 5000
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: On October 4, 2024, one (1) 1.5 gallon jug of Rapicide PA was damaged by a skid and released approximately less than one (<1) gallon of product to the dock floor. R+L Carriers retained Cura Emergency Services, LC who dispatched a crew from Indiana Spill Response (ISR) to remediate the impacted site. The crew deployed soda ash to neutralize the released product. The crew then deployed granular absorbents and utilized hand tools to work them in. All Rapicide PA-impacted materials were collected and containerized into one (1) 55-gallon drum.

SDS OBTAINED FROM ALLIANCE CHEMICAL WEBSITE REVEALS PRODUCT IS REGULATED AS DANGEROUS GOODS DURING AIR TRANSPORTATION. THIS PACKAGE HAS NOT BEEN ACCEPTED FOR AIR OR TRANSPORTED IN THE AIR BY UNITED PARCEL SERVICE CO.
